questions.question_text: When creating an address object, which option is available to select from the Type drop-down menu?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The four types of address objects are:
● IP Netmask
● IP Range
● IP Wildcard Mask
● FQDN

Selected Answer: B
B correct, checked on our firewall

Selected Answer: D
D checked on our firewall

Selected Answer: D
D. The default static IP address.

Selected Answer: D
D:
In destination field you must define IP/Netmask. Otherwise you cannot save (OK) the configuration.

Selected Answer: D
0.0.0.0/0
D Correct!

questions.question_text: Where within the URL Filtering security profile must a user configure the action to prevent credential submissions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A checked on our firewall

Selected Answer: A
checked on our firewall

A - 
In the Categories tab of the URL Filtering profile, you can set the User Credential Submission action to “block” or “continue” for each category1234. This allows you to control whether users can submit credentials to sites within those categories1234.

A is Correct
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/advanced-url-filtering/administration/url-filtering-basics/url-filtering-profiles

Selected Answer: A
Verified in FW

Selected Answer: A
URL filtering technology protects users from web-based threats by providing granular control over user access and interaction with content on the Internet. You can develop a URL filtering policy that limits access to sites based on URL categories, users, and groups. For example, you can block access to sites known to host malware and prevent end users from entering corporate credentials to sites in certain categories.
A is Correct

Ans A: Step 5. https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/advanced-url-filtering/administration/url-filtering-features/credential-phishing-prevention/set-up-credential-phishing-prevention#idfd42ebad-d0fc-415a-aadc-e222fc2beb80

questions.question_text: Which Security profile must be added to Security policies to enable DNS Signatures to be checked?

discussion.content: C. Page 97 Study Guide

Selected Answer: C
Yes..correct..
"In addition, you can enable the DNS sinkholing action in Anti-Spyware profiles to enable the firewall to forge a response to a DNS query for a known malicious domain, causing the malicious domain name to resolve to an IP address that you define"
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/11-0/pan-os-admin/policy/security-profiles

Selected Answer: CD
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/network-security/security-policy/administration/security-profiles/security-profile-dos-protection-profile

Selected Answer: CD
verified in FW
